Megatron heard the faint call. And Megatron answered. He began by helping =
contruct a new spark chamber, feeding it energon now. The chamber was becom=
ing too small, he moved the new spark chamber to a larger bay and began bui=
lding the framework for a new body. The voice sounded feminine, but he coul=
d not be sure. For now a body of its own would have to do for now.
=A0
"Ari=
se, stand strong again, warrior. Heed the call of Megatron."

--- On Fri, 7=
/3/09, Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@...> wrote:


From: Lady Barbossa <Max=
imaSR74@...>
Subject: Re: Returning Home
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Dat=
e: Friday, July 3, 2009, 4:57 AM








Time was all the spark needed to f=
igure out everything, especially that what which it was connected to. 

Aud=
io crackled at times, sounding like a ghost in the machine, working out the=
 kinks. Visual doing the same but not so easy this time as it kept running =
into problems. Support of all sorts to stay functional.. . indeed a challen=
ge but doable and working. 

In a "sleep" mode at times if not searching th=
rough the mass matrix of what was out there everywhere.. . the spark was mo=
re than a spark now. 
Connected to a bay that held various parts and a serv=
ice drone, the urgency of that spark's command was relayed easily enough to=
 give a silent if not eerie beginning to a new form behing any bot's back. =


Soon. 
Soon enough the spark will be more than just a mere light. Soon th=
e spark will be who she once was again... and moreso. 

But still... she ca=
lled out in that child-like helpless ghost of disembodied voice-
"help," it=
 weakly called out so soft, so scared.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com, "La=
dy Barbossa" <MaximaSR74@ ...> wrote:
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com, "=
chiyohakuryuu" <chiyohakuryuu@ > wrote:
> >
> > OOC: bleh, this old compute=
r is slowly dying. its taking a while to get te replacement, and my job is =
not helping matters. Gomen ne.
> > 
> Hope the comp thing gets resolved in =
due time. 
> 
> 
> > IC:
> > 
> > Working for hours, Megatro slowly fed pow=
er to the spark, coaxing it into strengthening the frail object. He sometim=
es wondered why h persisted, it did not see to be responding favorably. But=
 its condition was improving. He set the power build up to gradually build =
over time,and began writing an interface program thatwould allow he and the=
 spark to communicate once it had been sufficenty restored. 
> > 
> > barri=
er to preven any overload the new stimulis might bring, then an audio chann=
el coupled to a comm link, then the base's sensor net, localized to just th=
e room he was in, ten finlly a video line. 
> > 
> > "now if only you would=
 awakeand let me now if this was a mere distraction or waste of my time..."=

> > 
> > 
> > 
> 
> Time and power was all it needed... for now. What had =
been just a mere spark of a light was now glowing and vibrant. Reaching out=
 to figure out how to respond and command a new body, now finally rid of th=
at pathetic organic form. Starting anew was not so bad. 
> 
> Reaching out =
through the vast maze that was the computer and various electronical forms.=
.. she did her best to "urge" what Decepticon that was nearby to help. Perh=
aps do her bidding. Oh, yes. One that would do her bidding would be very ni=
ce. Seek out what materials be needed to construct a new form - a form far =
more powerful than before she was merged into that sad techno-organic form.=
 
> 
> Attempting to sound distant, restained, and helpless... a child or w=
oman lost in time and space, any way to get someone to pay attention, prefe=
rably a Decepticon-
> Maybe that being with rescued her from nearly extinqu=
ishing? 
> 
> "help," rang out ever so softly, weak and helpless it sounded=
. 
> Whatever it was that helped her then, rescued her would hear her now. =
She was being helped moreso by technology. Her spark could call out. 
> 
> =
"someone... please... help." 
> The spark called out to it's rescuer.. or a=
ny bot that called itself Decepticon.
>
